words.defineEn: any of the letters in the New Testament, written by the apostles
words.defineVi: bất kỳ bức thư nào trong Tân Ước, được viết bởi các sứ đồ

examples: Many of these early works were in the style of the epistolary novel, which is a story composed of letters, and we see echoes of that form in Pride and Prejudice.
words.defineEn: written in the form of or carried on by letters or correspondence
words.defineVi: được viết dưới dạng hoặc được thực hiện bằng thư từ hoặc thư từ

examples: For now you’ve learned about the historical origins of philosophy in ancient Greece, and its three main divisions: metaphysics, epistemology, and value theory.
words.defineEn: the branch of philosophy in which knowledge is studied
words.defineVi: ngành triết học trong đó kiến thức được nghiên cứu

words.defineEn: a large entrance or reception room or area
words.defineVi: một lối vào lớn hoặc phòng tiếp tân hoặc khu vực

words.defineEn: establish something as being earlier relative to something else
words.defineVi: thiết lập một cái gì đó như là sớm hơn so với một cái gì đó khác

words.defineEn: be earlier in time; go back further
words.defineVi: sớm hơn trong thời gian; quay trở lại xa hơn

words.defineEn: so extremely old as seeming to belong to an earlier period
words.defineVi: quá cũ như dường như thuộc về một thời kỳ trước đó
xảy ra hoặc tồn tại trước khi sinh

examples: The most common type is anterior epistaxis where blood vessels from a group inside your nostrils rupture, and usually it only involves one nostril.
These regions, the anterior cingulate cortex and the insula, are important for decision-making and emotion.
The anterior cingulate cortex, or ACC, and the insula, meanwhile, deal with your response to the pain.
When you quickly change direction while running, the anterior cruciate ligament is basically the only thing holding the two halves of your leg together.
So your eyes are anterior, and your butt is posterior, but you’d also say that your breastbone is anterior to, or in front of, the spine, and that the heart is posterior to, or behind the breastbone.
words.defineEn: of or near the head end or toward the front plane of a body
words.defineVi: của hoặc gần đầu hoặc về phía mặt phẳng phía trước của cơ thể

words.defineEn: a large entrance or reception room or area
words.defineVi: một lối vào lớn hoặc phòng tiếp tân hoặc khu vực

examples: I am loath to give any particular timeframe or dates or reasons because that’s part of the intelligence business.
words.defineVi: (thường được theo sau bởi `to') phản đối mạnh mẽ

examples: Human nature is generally of such kind that it will choose a line of least resistance if that is at all possible, and loathe exertion beyond it.
I know you're passionate about the topic, but remember that length begets loathing, so try to keep your presentation concise.
Self-hatred, self-loathing, low self esteem, no self confidence.
And I think they've been loathe to give away that secret sauce.
words.defineEn: to dislike something or someone very much often with a sense of disgust
words.defineVi: không thích một cái gì đó hoặc một ai đó rất thường xuyên với một cảm giác ghê tởm

examples: And then when the science became irrefutable
On a very similar note, Popper also pointed out that irrefutable theories are not scientific.

While there was an irrefutable link between sugary drinks and type 2 diabetes in their data, the link between diet drinks and diabetes disappeared when they corrected for other potential factors like the participants’ starting weight.
But the evidence they provided was irrefutable.
words.defineEn: incapable of being disproved or denied
words.defineVi: không có khả năng bị từ chối hoặc từ chối
